body.p:
This day your letter per Mr
Hart was handed me by Mr Moses, Mr Hart not
being a visitor of ours) I am not intending to
apologize for my long silence for as you say
(altho' I find sufficient to occupy me during
the day.) I could find a few minutes of an
evening after my lettle ones go to bed to
write but in truth, I feel no desire to write
any one any more, I have not any thing pleasing
to communicate nothing by whic I can interest
and why should I impose the task on any friends
to prase my dull epistles I am glad to hear of
the well doing of them all and, if I could
communicate pleasant circumstances I would with
pleasure, shall I recapitulate the story of
no servants, the dislike of the want of Judaism
reigning here—My fear of the im?sions of
my children should I have to raise them here my
discontent at being far away from my dear Mother
family & old friends, no I think it wiser, to
bear all the evils in silence which also beset us in our
passage through this life of trial, and let
others whose fate is brighter enjoy it—
My sweet children are thank God well and
improving in beauty and intelligence I
Rosalie as ? she is beginning to learn,
and Rehine can say his prayers alone I shall
try to give them a correct idea of our religion,
my babe Sarah is a very handsome child the
handsomest of mine, black eyes and good skin.

Sarah is not married yet nor is there any
prospect at present times to dull with her
beau- her mother has by this time repented
having given up her boarders, for Master
Hillel has cheated her in their store
business and gone off Sam is another
Rascal, and Hyman on the track poor weak
woman to let those children treat her so
and to let one follow the steps of the rest
I pity her)blindess, the girls cannot get the
opportunity to be worse but are very much
neglected Abby is very wild I wish she was
safely housed— I wish you Joy on the arrival
of your Brother I hope it will be a satisfaction,
is your sister Married? give my love to Sarah
Lyon & A Allen, and all friends—do mention
whether Elkalah's child was the only one the
or what more particular—we were very
surprised at Mr Hart's return without a wife,
his Brother celebrated his wedding day I am
told do you know the reason? You have no
apology for your short letters be more
particular and write plainer I cannot read all
you words Mr Bloch says as you did not mention
him he shall not you, so you see he is particular—
Eleanor is still living with Mrs Moses
who is not at all particular, but she
says she intends to keep a cosher house
herself when she goes to housekeeping
may be for Pisach she will, she is
getting over her religious fit very
easily the force of example operates

greatly on some minds—x' tis
nearly ten and am expecting my
babe to wake and as I am her O...
nurse must prepare for her—
Malinaa is with me but poor thing
very sickly—Miss Bridella is
also living with us—Abraham has
gone with Joseph to keep store
in the country, we have too country
boys in place of him & Father in
the store untill Mr Bloch can get
a good young man to attend to
business—adieu write by the
of Mr. Johnson
return a Pureem Present a Megilla
I wish you a merry Pureem

Why did Poor Reinah leave Uncle's?
let me know all—

Polite attention
of
Mr Johnson
W G P
